# Regression models: interactions using indexing {#sec-regression-interaction-index} ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Area-Statistics-red) ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Area-R-green) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} polite <- read_csv("data/winter2012/polite.csv") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int2 <- brm( f0mn ~ 0 + gender:attitude, family = gaussian, data = polite, cores = 4, seed = 7123, file = "cache/ch-regression-interaction-index_f0_bm_int2" ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(f0_bm_int2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Family: gaussian Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity Formula: f0mn ~ 0 + gender:attitude Data: polite (Number of observations: 212) Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1; total post-warmup draws = 4000 Regression Coefficients: Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS genderF:attitudeinf 256.61 5.16 246.73 266.76 1.00 5037 2982 genderM:attitudeinf 137.23 5.87 125.37 148.66 1.00 5491 2936 genderF:attitudepol 238.93 5.08 229.06 248.85 1.00 5191 2912 genderM:attitudepol 126.28 5.82 114.88 137.71 1.00 5455 3018 Further Distributional Parameters: Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS sigma 39.13 1.94 35.51 43.18 1.00 4975 3159 Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1). ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} conditional_effects(f0_bm_int2, "gender:attitude") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ch-regression-interaction-index_files/figure-html/f0-bm-int2-cond-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int2_draws <- as_draws_df(f0_bm_int2) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int2_draws <- f0_bm_int2_draws |> mutate( f_pol_inf = `b_genderF:attitudepol` - `b_genderF:attitudeinf`, m_pol_inf = `b_genderM:attitudepol` - `b_genderM:attitudeinf`, ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(posterior) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` This is posterior version 1.6.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'posterior' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': mad, sd, var ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:base': %in%, match ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int2_draws |> summarise( mean_diff = mean(m_pol_inf), sd_diff = sd(m_pol_inf), lo_diff = quantile2(m_pol_inf, probs = 0.025), hi_diff = quantile2(m_pol_inf, probs = 0.975) ) |> round() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: :::
